text: Nokul or Lokum is a type of puff pastry. Nokul is a type of pastry eaten in Turkey and Bulgaria with variations. Nokul is sometimes served hot as an appetizer instead of bread. It consists of a rolled sheet of yeast dough onto which feta-style white cheese, walnut or poppy seed is sprinkled over a thin coat of butter. The dough is then rolled, cut into individual portions, and baked. ==See also== *Bejgli *Cantiq *Cozonac *Lokma *Nut roll *Pogaca *Poppy seed roll *Tsoureki ==References== Category:Turkish cuisine Category:Bulgarian cuisine Category:Yeast breads Category:Appetizers Category:Turkish breads Category:Tatar cuisine Category:Puff pastry
title: Nokul
